courseTitle: An example criteria set to show you how it works

sections.learningOutcome: Understand how to use the Criteria Tracker application

criteria.title: Navigate the Criteria Tracker interface
guidance: Familiarize yourself with the main sections of the application, including the dashboard, criteria sets, and progress tracking.
Learn how to access a specific criteria set by selecting it from the list of available sets.

criteria.title: Track progress on a specific criterion
guidance: Click on a criteria to view or edit its details.
There is also a + button to add a new claim.
You can delete claims using the delete button when you view it.
Claims have a evidence field, a date field, a confirmed checkbox, and a source field.
Make sure to save your changes after editing or adding claims.
The pink stars are there to help you enter information quickly. e.g. clicking the star next to 'Written' will give you suggestions for evidence and set the source to 'Written'.

criteria.title: Generate a report
guidance: You can export your progress to a CSV file in more or less the CPCAB format.
Use this when you're ready to submit your evidence and add it to your portfolio.
You can use a tool like MS Excel or Google Sheets to open the CSV file and format it as needed.
